trans-unit.source: Provides a user interface for indicating that a control on a form has an error associated with it.
ErrorProvider presents a simple mechanism for indicating to the end user that a control on a form has an error associated with it.
If an error description string is specified for the control, an icon appears next to the control.
The icon flashes in the manner specified by <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.BlinkStyle%2A>, at the rate specified by <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.BlinkRate%2A>.
When the mouse hovers over the icon, a ToolTip appears showing the error description string.
Typically, you use ErrorProvider in association with data-bound controls.

When using ErrorProvider with data-bound controls, you must specify the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.ContainerControl%2A>, either in the constructor or by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.ContainerControl%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > The ErrorProvider component does not provide built-in support for accessibility clients.
To make your application accessible when using this component, you must provide an additional, accessible feedback mechanism.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider"></xref> class and initializes the default settings for <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.BlinkRate*>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.BlinkStyle*>, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.Icon*>.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider>.

|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.Icon%2A>|An icon that consists of an exclamation point in a circle with a red background| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.BlinkRate%2A>|250| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.BlinkStyle%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorBlinkStyle>|
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider"></xref> class attached to an <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IContainer"></xref> implementation.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.IContainer> specified is the container object for the data-bound controls to associate the error provider with.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IContainer"></xref> to monitor for errors.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider"></xref> class attached to a container.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> specified by <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.ContainerControl%2A> is the container object for the data-bound controls to associate the error provider with.
The container of the control to monitor for errors.
Provides a method to set both the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.DataSource*> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.DataMember*> at run time.

To avoid conflicts at run time that can occur when changing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.DataMember%2A>, you should use BindToDataAndErrors instead of setting <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.DataMember%2A> individually.
A data set based on the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface to be monitored for errors.
Typically, this is a <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> to be monitored for errors.
A collection within the `newDataSource` to monitor for errors.
Typically, this will be a <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
Gets or sets the rate at which the error icon flashes.
The error icon flashes at the specified rate.
A value of zero sets <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.BlinkStyle%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorBlinkStyle>.
The rate, in milliseconds, at which the error icon should flash.
The default is 250 milliseconds.
The value is less than zero.
Gets or sets a value indicating when the error icon flashes.
The error icon flashes in the manner specified by the assigned <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorBlinkStyle> when an error occurs.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.BlinkRate%2A> to zero sets the BlinkStyle to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorBlinkStyle>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ErrorBlinkStyle"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ErrorBlinkStyle"></xref>.
The assigned value is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ErrorBlinkStyle"></xref> values.
Gets a value indicating whether a control can be extended.
Typically, you will use CanExtend to determine whether you can attach an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider> to the specified control.
The control to be extended.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control can be extended; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

This property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the object is a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> and is not a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar"></xref>.
Clears all settings associated with this component.
Calling this method clears all property settings for this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider>, restoring the properties to their default values.
To clear the error message, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.SetError%2A> method and pass in <xref:System.String.Empty> for the <xref:System.String> value.
This removes the error glyph from the specified <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control>.
Gets or sets a value indicating the parent control for this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider"></xref>.
Typically, this is the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> the data-bound controls reside on.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl"></xref> that contains the controls that the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider"></xref> is attached to.
Gets or sets the list within a data source to monitor.
The DataMember is a navigation string based on <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.DataSource%2A>.

To avoid conflicts at run time that can occur when changing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.DataSource%2A> and DataMember, you should use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.BindToDataAndErrors%2A> instead of setting <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.DataSource%2A> and DataMember individually.
The string that represents a list within the data source specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.DataSource*> to be monitored.
Typically, this will be a <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
Gets or sets the data source that the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider"></xref> monitors.
The DataSource is a data source that you can attach to a control and that you want to monitor for errors.
DataSource can be set to any collection that implements <xref:System.Collections.IList>.

To avoid conflicts at run time that can occur when changing DataSource and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.DataMember%2A>, you should use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.BindToDataAndErrors%2A> instead of setting DataSource and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.DataMember%2A> individually.
A data source based on the <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface to be monitored for errors.
Typically, this is a <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> to be monitored for errors.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to release both managed and unmanaged resources; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to release only unmanaged resources.
Returns the current error description string for the specified control.
The item to get the error description string for.
The error description string for the specified control.
control is .
Gets a value indicating where the error icon should be placed in relation to the control.
The control to get the icon location for.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ErrorIconAlignment"></xref> values.
The default icon alignment is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ErrorIconAlignment"></xref>.
control is .
Returns the amount of extra space to leave next to the error icon.
Many icons typically have extra space around their central images, so the padding value is only necessary if additional space is necessary.
Padding values can be positive or negative.
Negative values cause the icon to overlap the edge of the control.
The default icon padding is 0.
The control to get the padding for.
The number of pixels to leave between the icon and the control.
control is .
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> that is displayed next to a control when an error description string has been set for the control.
For best results, use an icon of the size 16 x 16 pixels.
Specified icons are resized to be 16 x 16 pixels, if necessary.
An <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> that signals an error has occurred.
The default icon consists of an exclamation point in a circle with a red background.
The assigned value of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.RightToLeftChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnRightToLeftChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the component is used in a locale that supports right-to-left fonts.
When this property is set to true, the error icon appears to the left of the associated control and the ToolTip text is displayed in right-to-left order.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the component is used in a right-to-left locale; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.RightToLeft*> property changes value.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Sets the error description string for the specified control.
If the length of `value` is greater than zero, then the error icon is displayed, and the ToolTip for the error icon is the error description text.
If the length is zero or `value` is `null`, the error icon is hidden.
The control to set the error description string for.
The error description string, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> or <xref:System.String> to remove the error.
control is .
Sets the location where the error icon should be placed in relation to the control.
The final placement of the icon is modified by the icon padding values.
The control to set the icon location for.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ErrorIconAlignment"></xref> values.
control is .
Sets the amount of extra space to leave between the specified control and the error icon.
Many icons typically have extra space around their central images, so the padding value is only necessary when additional space is necessary.
Padding values can be positive or negative.
Negative values cause the icon to overlap the edge of the control.
The `control` to set the padding for.
The number of pixels to add between the icon and the `control`.
control is .
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ISite"></xref> of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ISite"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref>, or null if the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref> is not encapsulated in an <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IContainer"></xref>, the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref> does not have an <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ISite"></xref> associated with it, or the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref> is removed from its <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IContainer"></xref>.
Signals the object that initialization is starting.
Signals the object that initialization is complete.
Gets or sets an object that contains data about the component.
Use this property to store custom data about the component.
An object that contains data about the control.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Provides a method to update the bindings of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.DataSource*>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.DataMember*>, and the error text.
Typically, you call this method after you have called <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.BindToDataAndErrors%2A>.
